thread.title: Lealiifano in remission and targeting a return to rugby action
thread.title_full: Lealiifano in remission and targeting a return to rugby action

title: Lealiifano in remission and targeting a return to rugby action
text:
Christian Lealiifano in remission and targeting a return to action with the Brumbies Posted February 19, 2017 10:58:26 
Brumbies co-captain Christian Lealiifano is determined to return to the ruby field after revealing his successful bone marrow transplant has sent his leukaemia into remission. 
Lealiifano received his diagnosis six months ago, and underwent the transplant procedure 100 days ago on Saturday. 
With all the signs positive, he says his next target is returning to the field to train and play with his team-mates. 
"The bone marrow transplant was a big success in Melbourne. The blood cells in my body are now 100 per cent my sister's blood cells, so in theory that should show that I'm in remission," Lealiifano told the ABC. 
"All along my main motivator has been to one day return and play again, but we'll see how we go. 
"I'm taking it day by day, and if I get a chance to run around with the team again, that's an extra bonus. 
Lealiifano says the specialist he has been seeing in Melbourne shares his high hopes for the future. 
"He's pretty optimistic with how it's all gone. We've still got a long way to go but at the moment, we've had some great news so far with this little milestone."
